net.cloud.server.entity.player

Class PlayerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.entity.player.PlayerFactory

  • public class PlayerFactory
extends Object
    Static factory.
    Static methods for the various use cases for creating player objects. A centralized location for all the different ways players are made.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerFactory()

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerFactory

        public PlayerFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • createOnNewConnection

        public static Player createOnNewConnection(PacketSender packetSender,
                                           PlayerChannelConfig config)
        Create a Player object for usage after a connection has been made. The player can be placed in the world map, and is pretty much a blank slate.
        Parameters:
        packetSender - The PacketSender object the Player will use
        config - Object holding channel initialization info
        Returns:
        A new Player object with minimal details

      • createNewAccount

        public static AccountCreationResult createNewAccount(String username,
                                                     String password)
        Attempt to create a new player account. Will fail if the account already exists, of course. May also fail if the process in general cannot complete. A new player is created and then their data is saved to file. It will not treat it like the player has logged in, so the player cannot be interacted with.
        Parameters:
        username - The username the player wants
        password - The password that will be set to the account
        Returns:
        A result with a message that may be used if desired

      • accountExists

        private static boolean accountExists(String username)
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the prospective account
        Returns:
        True if the account name is taken

      • createNewPlayer

        public static Player createNewPlayer(String username,
                                     String password)
        Create a new Player object with default data state. It will not have any constructs for sending data, and is just intended for creating a new account. To create and save a new account, use createNewAccount(...)
        Parameters:
        username - Username
        password - Password
        Returns:
        A new, fresh player object

      • createPlayerForDataUpdate

        public static Player createPlayerForDataUpdate(String username)
        Create a lightweight player object for when save data is being updated to the latest format. Only has a username set, nothing else - so that the data can be loaded from this.
        Parameters:
        username - I.e. the file name
        Returns:
        A player object to load data into
